title: Creating a Django project from a custom template
body: ## Django repository template I have created a [Django Project Template](https://github.com/kemu3007/django- project- template) using GitHub's Repository Template feature, and this is its description and implementation procedure. ## Create a repository from a template. [Django Project Template](https://github.com/kemu3007/django- project- template) - - - - - Click the `Use this template` button in the upper right corner of the screen to create a new repository using the template. ## Template Contents ### .github/workflows, Makefile CI is automatically fired when push and pull_requests are created/synced to main. CI runs the `lint` and `test` commands defined in the Makefile, which is defined to use the Django default testing framework, so if you switch to pytest, you can modify the `test` command in the Makefile to apply it automatically. The `test` command in the Makefile will be applied automatically. Check `setup.cfg` and `pyproject.toml` for linter settings. black, isort has version control with `requirements.dev.txt` since the formatting result may change at times due to version issues. ### docker- compose.yml Launch a custom image based on the python:3.10 image that installs the contents of requirements.txt and run `python src/manage.py runserver`. ## Check operation We use docker- compose v2. ```zsh $ docker compose up -d ``` Since the default is to start on port 8000, access `localhost:8000` with a browser, and if the following screen is displayed, it is OK. ## tips A template repository can be created from the following settings (I only recently learned about this. The repository created based on the template will have `generated from kemu3007/django- project- template' under the repository name. ` is displayed.
